content: inspired by roses and the everyday joy they bring surprising us with early buds in spring just when we thought a little bush might not come back after a long winter delighting us with delicate petals in every colour throughout summer hanging on in autumn with exquisite late blooms and in some places though not here in canada even flowering in winter against all odds i hope this shawl brings you moments of simple joy too as you create it and then wear it whatever the season might be * a collaboration with the lab fibers link for kits * https //thelabfibers com/pages/winter-rose-shawl * symmetrical triangular shawl 61x41x41 inches blocked yarn and notions - 2x100g skein of fingering at least 430-450 yards each referred to in the pattern simply as colours 1 and 2 - sample knit in the lab fibers everyday fingering colours flamingo and sparkle pop - 3 stitch markers plus a progress marker to identify the front of your work - scissors and tapestry needle for weaving in ends needles 3 75mm us size 5 circular needles 80cm or 32 cable suggested gauge blocked 20 stitches = 4 inches in stockinette and garter 24 sts unblocked
